Take a Virtual Tour of our Event Space!
Interactive and three-dimensional, our virtual event space features a realistic online tour showing you 360-degree panoramic views of
our Boca Ceiga Ballroom. If you can't visit Isla Del Sol in person, the virtual tour is the next best thing to being here!

Event Inquiry Form

Summer Memberships at Isla
Thank you for your interest in a Summer Membership at Isla Del Sol Yacht and Country Club! The Summer Application period starts April 1, 2025 and Summer Memberships commence May 1, 2025. Please complete this application, save, and submit to our Membership Director, Melissa Rowjohn:
[email protected]
, or drop off at the Isla Del Sol Y&CC Executive Office Front Desk located at 6000 Sun Boulevard, St. Petersburg, FL 33715.
Download the Isla 2025 Summer Application
Summer Golf - $3,966* Family / $3,042* Individual
Unlimited golf access, cart fees apply
Unlimited tennis/pickleball access, no court fees
Private lessons available
Club dining privileges
24/7 access to fitness center
Access to Club swimming pool
Locker rooms
Summer social events and activities
Access to transient dock when available
Online access to member center and app for reservations, Club information, and account management
$500 Food & Beverage minimum
Summer Racquet - $1,744*
7 lighted Har-Tru tennis courts
6 lighted pickleball courts
Unlimited tennis/pickleball access, no court fees
Private lessons available
Club dining privileges
24/7 access to fitness center
Access to Club swimming pool
Locker rooms
Summer social events and activities
Access to transient dock when available
Online access to member center and app for reservations, Club information, and account management
$500 Food & Beverage minimum
Summer Social - $1,097*
Club dining privileges
24/7 access to fitness center
Access to Club swimming pool
Locker rooms
Summer social events and activities
Access to transient dock when available
Online access to member center and app for reservations, Club information, and account management
$500 Food & Beverage minimum
*Taxes apply to dues. Isla Members may have guests, pursuant the current Club guest policy. If you have a Summer Membership, you may bring guests who would be subject to the prevailing guest fees and rules. Guests must be accompanied by a current member and can visit the Club no more than twice a month and pay the current guest fees.
All Summer Memberships are subject to a $500 Food & Beverage Minimum (prorated according to sign up date) required to be spent during the Summer Membership period and must be completely spent by September 30, 2025. If the minimum is not met, the balance will be charged to the Member account at the end of the Summer Membership period.
Portions of the clubhouse will be under renovation starting June 2025. While every effort will be made to minimize disruptions, certain areas, amenities, or services may be temporarily unavailable during this time.

Facebook Pixel Code
End Facebook Pixel Code
Plan an Event
Isla Del Sol Yacht & Country Club is the perfect setting for your private event whether for business or for pleasure. Come experience our private beachfront for an intimate private wedding/vow renewal ceremony or host a beachside party for your closest friends. The Boca Ceiga Ballroom named after the gorgeous waterway it overlooks provides a romantic background for wedding receptions and social events alike for groups of 250 guests or less. Looking for something more intimate? Our Private Dining Room is also available for groups of 60 people or less also offering spectacular waterfront views and an elegant ambiance. Our 18-hole championship golf course is only steps away from our incredible clubhouse and is available for golf tournaments seasonally. Whatever type of event you are planning; we have the facilities, culinary delights and professional staff to compliment your vision and special occasion.
Event Inquiry Form
Virtual Walk Thru
Weddings
Social & Business Events
Golf Tournaments

Facebook Pixel Code
End Facebook Pixel Code
Membership at Isla Del Sol
Isla Del Sol Yacht & Country Club has a number of very attractive membership package options to meet the unique needs of our active members.
Isla Del Sol offers its members a prestigious level of service as well as a quality lifestyle. World class golf, exceptional tennis and pickleball, active Yacht Club, numerous member activities, outstanding personal service, great members and we offer attractive membership packages which distinguish Isla Del Sol as the leading private club in the area. The Club offers its members the environment, facilities, and services that satisfy their sports, social, and business interest and needs. In addition, all of our amenities are staffed with carefully selected and trained employees whose only goal is member satisfaction.
Currently, we have a waitlist for Golf but if you would like to be put on our inquiry list or would like to tour our facility, please email us at
[email protected]
or call 727-906-4752 for further details.
As we like to say “Come Play on Our Island!”
Membership Inquiry
Annual Memberships
Equity Family or Equity Individual Golf
Golf has become more than just a game or a pastime. It has become the perfect way to meet people and to bring friends, family, and associates together. The Isla Del Sol golf course is an exceptional 18 hole championship layout. Challenging fairways, beautiful bunkered greens, shimmering lakes, beautiful view of Boca Ciega Bay and gardens enhance the beauty and heighten the challenge of the course. Equity Non-refundable joining fees are allocated pursuant to the Club Policies & Prodedures and is based on membership programming.
Currently we have a waitlist for annual Golf Memberships. If you would like to take a tour and talk about your membership options please email
[email protected]
for further details.
Equity Young Executive Golf
The Young Executive Golf Membership at Isla Del So Yacht & Country Club is ideal for golfers between the ages of 21 and 39 who are looking to improve their game, socialize, and have the convenience of having both golf and leisure facilities all in one great location.
Currently we have a waitlist for annual Golf Memberships. If you would like to take a tour and talk about your membership options please email
[email protected]
for further details.
Yacht
Currently, we have a waitlist for annual slips that are lifts. If you would like to take a tour and talk about your membership options please email
[email protected]
for further details.
76 slip rentals in Isla's very own gated Yacht Basin (montly fees apply)
Easy marine access to Gulf of Mexico, the Sunshine Skyway Bridge and Shell Island
Each slip is equipped with electric pedestals, hoses & lock boxes
Free Wi-Fi, Cable TV accessible with appropriate fees
Captain's Lounge (showers, laundry room, deep sinks, refrigerator, coffee makers, microwave, crushed ice, sea charts, and television)
Invitation to all Club Social Events
Night Patrolled Security
Unlimited use of the dining facilities, pool bar & clubhouse access
24-hour Fitness Center
Banquet and Private Meeting Space/Wi-Fi Access
Portable Pump-out access
Racquet
There are 7 carefully maintained, well-lit courts with Har-Tru surfaces, and 6 Pickleball courts. Most days and many nights you can find them filled with enthusiastic players. Each year, our certified USPTA and USPTR professionals and hard working tennis and pickleball committees, comprised of members, fashion a well organized, active schedule of events to supplement daily play.
There are many special tournaments throughout the year. Our active groups get together for dinners, awards, banquets, picnics and barbecues.
7 lighted Har-Tru Tennis courts
6 lighted Pickleball courts
Unlimited tennis and pickleball play, no court fees
Advanced court times
Private lessons available
Dining privileges
Full access to fitness center
Unlimited use of swimming pool*
Locker room access
Summer social events and activities
Access to transient dock when available
Online access to member center and app for reservations, club information, and account management
House
Our social House Membership at Isla Del Sol Yacht and Country Club offers you the following:
Dining privileges
Full access to fitness center
Unlimited use of swimming pool*
Locker room access
Summer social events and activities
Access to transient dock when available
Online access to member center and app for reservations, club information, and account management
Member Testimonials
"Joining Isla Del Sol was one of the very best decisions my wife and I ever made. Here are several reasons why this TRUE Club is so wonderful. Please allow me to highlight a few:
1) Quality employees that treat you as family and quickly become folks you wish to have as friends.
2) Exceptional Golf Pros: None better anywhere than Fred, Josh and the entire staff. I am so impressed with the level of service and professional the golf team at Isla displays.
3) Fun everywhere. There is always a fun event, outing, tourney, money game or charity event available. Busy fun happy place this Isla Del Sol!
4) Our golf course is so beautiful, pristine and in a great location! I am in awe of the high quality maintenance done daily on the course.  Outstanding greens, fairways, tee boxes, all beautifully landscaped. I drive up Gulf Blvd to the bridge by the Don and it is amazing how pumped I get  looking at all this scenery and beauty. Wow!
5) My wife LOVES TENNIS, she now plays lots. She loves the pros, the courts, the fellow tennis players, the format, and the clinics.
6) The food is terrific food and we enjoy all of the special nights you have. Love the food and service at the pool bar. What a fun setting and comfortable place to unwind after the round. WOW! Nice to dine at the club that cares!
7) People: There must be a unwritten policy where you only let nice people join, because that is all I have met at Isla. From John and Angelo who run a few of the money games, to partners we have met to all the folks my wife and I have had during competitions.
ALL
folks at Isla are nice. Must be because they are Happy to be blessed to be Isla members! Folks truly are kind, friendly and happy.  Great people!
8) I witnessed the true caring of the club, as I just participated in my first Special Operations charity fundraiser in November. What a privilege to see how the club rallies around this cause. So kind, so caring, so special, so important.
9) We LOVE Isla. We feel so comfortable and happy, we feel excited to come play at this resort, while on the property we feel like we are on vacation. Pinch us, we must be dreaming as we feel at this fabulous place called Isla Del Sol, well......honestly we feel as members....we are treated like Family.
We live, laugh and love Isla Lots!"
Best, Mike and Tammy Meyer, Members since February 2018
"I first became interested in Isla in 1983 when I moved from Illinois to Bayway Isles. I would take my daughter golfing there in the afternoon (dodging thunder storms).
My wife and I joined Isla in 2008 after our disappointment with other clubs we were members of in St Petersburg. We have found Isla to be a very caring well-run club. The employees are very concerned about the members, and always go to extremes to be very helpful.
The golf course is beautiful and very well maintained, the food and the service is excellent, and the clubhouse and pool are also very accommodating.
We are very pleased to be members and enjoy bringing our friends and family to Isla often."
~Werner and Martha Koester, Members since 2008

Meet Our Team
Have a general inquiry?
Please contact the front desk at 727-906-4752
[email protected]
General Manager
Robert Rankin
(727) 906-4752
2073
[email protected]
Robert was born and raised in North Carolina where he graduated from Western Carolina University. He began his career as a private club General Manager in Atlanta, Georgia in 1986. He went to work for ClubCorp and moved to Florida where he was general manager at DeBary Golf &  Country Club and Countryside Country Club. He was promoted to regional manager for the northwest Florida region in 2001. He joined the team at Isla in 2009. He lives in Trinity with his wife Jill and daughter Ava. Robert enjoys the outdoors, golf, fishing and boating. His favorite activity is scuba diving with Ava.
Director of Catering, Interim Membership POC
Melissa Rowjohn
(727) 828-0003
[email protected]
Born in Boulder, Colorado, Melissa moved to Florida in 2000 and graduated from the Rosen School of Hospitality Management at University of Central Florida in May 2004. Melissa later met her husband, Matthew, while living in Orlando and recently welcomed her daughter, Harper to the world. Melissa started her event career in the Orlando theme parks, then moved on to planning events for hotels including Ritz-Carlton, Gaylord Palms, Marriott, Hilton, Hyatt and many more throughout the state of Florida. Having experience in managing, planning and executing corporate events, tradeshows, association meetings, weddings and social events; Melissa soon realized her passion for weddings! In 2015, Isla Del Sol provided Melissa with an exclusive and private venue where she serves as the Director of Catering & Special Events allowing her creativity to come to life. Melissa thoroughly enjoys her passion through her career while also spending time with her family and friends.
Food & Beverage Director
Paul Simpson
(727) 906-4752
2015
[email protected]
Paul comes to Isla with over 30 years experience in Food and Beverage Management. He has managed fine dining restaurants, casual concepts, and practically every type of banquet event! Having worked at Innisbrook and Crescent Oaks in the past, he is very familiar with the country club life!

Paul has 2 beautiful daughters that just graduated from Tampa University. He is an avid golfer and a huge Tampa Bay Lightning & Cincinnati Bengal's fan.

"I'm really looking forward to working with Robert and the F&B team and want to do my best in elevating the expectations of service, dining, and events for our members at Isla!"
Executive Chef
Dan Hilbert
(727) 864-0467
2012
Chef Dan, is originally from Babylon, New York, he has lived in the Tampa Bay area for the last two years. He has experience in the private Club industry, most recently in Manhattan, NY at the Colony Club. He also lived in Key West for seven years and worked on top of Mount Snow at a ski resort in Vermont. When Chef Dan is not working, he loves the outdoors and enjoys his fun in the sun at the beach. His favorite place is Honeymoon Island in Dunedin!
Service Director
Dino Anasri
(727) 906-4752
2048
[email protected]
Dino started at Isla in 1994 after he moved to St. Pete from Morocco Casa Blanca. This was his first job in the USA coming from Morocco. When he is not at work, he enjoys playing soccer and hanging out with his two beautiful daughters.
Food & Beverage Manager
Tyre Shivers
(727) 906-4752
2015
[email protected]
Tyre Shivers has been promoted to Food & Beverage Manager and will report to Paul Simpson. Originally from St. Petersburg, Tyre has worked at Isla since 2014 having started out as a busser. He has proven himself to be a valuable asset to the Club through his hard work and dedication.

Tyre is an avid fisherman, outdoorsman, and an aspiring charter captain. He also loves to spend time with his beautiful daughter, Alani.
Head Golf Professional
Fred Curtis
(727) 864-2417
[email protected]
Fred was born in Atlantic City, New Jersey. He grew up playing junior golf in the Atlantic City area and played four years of high school golf at Mainland Regional High School where he graduated in 1976. In 1978, Fred attended the University of Alabama where he played college golf. He graduated with a Bachelor of Science degree in Marketing in 1983.
After graduation, Fred joined the P.G.A of America and became a Class "A" member in 1988. He was the assistant professional at Ashbrook Golf Course from 1984 to 1989. He also worked as an assistant professional from 1985 through 1989 through the winter golf season. In 1990, Fred was hired by Isla Del Sol Y & CC as the Director of Golf. This is his 28th season. In 2015, Fred was named the West Central Chapter PGA Golf Professional of the Year and in 2016 he received the West Central Chapter PGA Patriot Award. He is currently serving as the West Central Chapter PGA Tournament Chairman.
Golf Course Superintendent
Chris Hewitt
(727) 201-9863
[email protected]
We are pleased to announce that Chris Hewitt has been selected as Isla’s new Golf Course Superintendent! Chris has maintained our course for 27 years. He was the Assistant Superintendent under Kevin Sunderman for the past 17 years. Chris has played an important role in building the values of our Grounds Crew and shares our vision for the club’s future. He understands what is needed to provide quality course conditions and will strive to meet our members’ expectations. 

Chris also has the experience to oversee large-scale inhouse projects like those conducted since creation of our Golf Course Master Plan. He has good relationship and experience working with our Golf Course Architect, Richard Mandell.
Dockmaster
Captain Richie Fowler
(727) 867-3625
[email protected]
Born in Bayshore, New York, Captain Richie moved to Florida in 1997 after graduating from Anderson University in South Carolina. He became Isla's Dockmaster in January of 2011 and lives on St. Pete Beach. He holds a 100 ton Master Captain’s license and enjoys lots of fishing, golfing and pulling parasail rides on off days.
Human Resources/Accounting
Ann Kaman
(727) 906-4752
2077
[email protected]
Ann joined the Isla family in April 2013. her duties include: payroll, on boarding of new hires, implementation of 401K, Workers Comp, EE Benefits, Unemployment compensation and account receivable.
House Maintenance
Willie Garcia
(727) 906-4752
Willie moved to Florida in 2005 and was a self-employed painter. He started at Isla in October 2007 and does some painting on the side as well. He works in the Maintenance Department with Tim. While Willie isn't working, he enjoys relaxing on the beach enjoying the Florida sun. Willie enjoys working at Isla because he says it is not just a company, but a family.
Director of Communications
Carrie Baltrusis
(727) 906-4752
2079
[email protected]
Carrie joins the Isla family with background in Marketing, Communications, and Design. On most weekends, you can find her relaxing on our beautiful beaches or exploring new restaurants.
Member Relations Assistant
Sherri DeSmet
(727) 906-4752
[email protected]
Sherri works the Front Desk on Tuesday through Sunday. After living in Michigan for 46 years, Sherri moved to Florida & she’ll never move back! Sherri joined Isla in 2019 as our weekend receptionist & is now working full-time as our receptionist/member relations assistant. 
Her background includes 22 years as a legal secretary.
She enjoys assisting our members & is always willing to help!
